critiques.subject: Profile close-up of a fluffy white Samoyed dog
preserve: The atmospheric bokeh lights in the background
The soft depth-of-field falloff on the nose
critiques.notes: A charming pet portrait with a nice composition. The primary work required is corrective: fixing the indoor lighting color cast and reducing noise, which will reveal the beautiful texture of the dog's coat.

improvements_detailed.reason: Reduce the strong yellow/tungsten cast to restore the natural white color of the fur.
Smooth out visible digital grain caused by high ISO settings in low light conditions.
Slightly lift exposure on the eye to create a focal point and add life to the subject.
Use a masking brush to add texture specifically to the fur area to emphasize fluffiness.

context.subject: Profile close-up of a fluffy white Samoyed dog
preserve: The atmospheric bokeh lights in the background
The soft depth-of-field falloff on the nose

critiques.subject: Close-up side profile of a fluffy white dog (Samoyed-type) indoors with warm bokeh lights
improvements: [MODERATE] Crop slightly from the left and bottom to remove the partial face/hand distractions and place the dog's eye nearer the upper-left third while keeping space in front of the nose
[SUBTLE] Apply a subject mask and lift midtones on the face/fur slightly (+0.2 to +0.4 EV), then reduce highlights on the brightest fur areas (Highlights -10 to -25) to keep texture
[SUBTLE] Enhance the eye with a small radial mask: add a touch of exposure/whites (+0.1 to +0.25), clarity/texture (+5 to +10), and mild sharpening; avoid overbrightening the catchlight
[MODERATE] Reduce noise in the background and shadows (Luminance NR ~20–35, Color NR ~20) while masking sharpening to edges (Amount moderate, Masking 70–90)
[SUBTLE] Cool white balance slightly (Temp down a bit) and/or reduce orange/yellow saturation in the background via HSL (-5 to -15) while keeping the dog’s fur neutral
preserve: The warm bokeh lights and soft indoor ambience
The natural fur texture and gentle depth-of-field
critiques.notes: The image has a strong, intimate moment with pleasing bokeh and a flattering side profile. Minor exposure lift and targeted detail on the eye will improve subject presence, while cropping and background noise reduction will remove distractions and polish the low-light look.

improvements_detailed.action: Crop slightly from the left and bottom to remove the partial face/hand distractions and place the dog's eye nearer the upper-left third while keeping space in front of the nose
improvements_detailed.reason: Simplifies the frame and strengthens subject emphasis and composition without changing the moment.

improvements_detailed.action: Apply a subject mask and lift midtones on the face/fur slightly (+0.2 to +0.4 EV), then reduce highlights on the brightest fur areas (Highlights -10 to -25) to keep texture
improvements_detailed.reason: Brings the dog forward and improves fur detail while avoiding a blown, flat look on white fur.

improvements_detailed.action: Enhance the eye with a small radial mask: add a touch of exposure/whites (+0.1 to +0.25), clarity/texture (+5 to +10), and mild sharpening; avoid overbrightening the catchlight
improvements_detailed.reason: A crisper, brighter eye increases perceived sharpness and emotional connection.

improvements_detailed.action: Reduce noise in the background and shadows (Luminance NR ~20–35, Color NR ~20) while masking sharpening to edges (Amount moderate, Masking 70–90)
improvements_detailed.reason: Cleans up the low-light grain without smearing fine fur detail.

improvements_detailed.action: Cool white balance slightly (Temp down a bit) and/or reduce orange/yellow saturation in the background via HSL (-5 to -15) while keeping the dog’s fur neutral
improvements_detailed.reason: Maintains the cozy indoor feel but prevents the whites from reading too warm and improves color separation from the background.
